title: Adding Measles to the List of Quarantinable Communicable Diseases

enrichment.summary: This executive order adds measles to the official list of diseases for which quarantine can be enforced to prevent the spread. It modifies a previous executive order to include measles alongside other communicable diseases, helping public health officials control outbreaks more effectively.
potential_concerns: Mandatory quarantine enforcement for measles may impose significant burdens on children-minors and their families, including disruptions to schooling and family life.
Homeless or unhoused individuals may face challenges in complying with quarantine orders due to lack of stable housing, potentially exacerbating health disparities.
Healthcare workers may experience increased demand and stress managing quarantines and measles outbreaks, which could impact healthcare system capacity.
Patients diagnosed with measles could face stigmatization or rights concerns related to enforcement of quarantine measures under this order.
